meanings.definition: Cause someone to feel isolated or estranged.
meanings.sent1: Bullying others can alienate them from their friends.
meanings.sent2: Constant criticism can alienate people and make them feel lonely.
meanings.sent3: Teasing your friend too much might alienate them from you.
meanings.sent4: His rude behavior alienates him from the rest of the group.
meanings.sent5: The new student's strange habits alienate him from the class.

meanings.sent1: Ignoring your friend can alienate them and make them upset.
meanings.sent2: Being rude to others can alienate them and create conflicts.
meanings.sent3: Laughing at someone's mistake might alienate them from you.
meanings.sent4: His aggressive attitude alienates people and pushes them away.
meanings.sent5: Her constant complaints alienate her colleagues and make them avoid her.

meanings.definition: Transfer ownership of property or rights to another person.
meanings.sent1: Selling a house alienates the ownership from the previous owner.
meanings.sent2: Signing a contract can alienate the rights to a new owner.
meanings.sent3: Giving away your old toys might alienate them from you, but it's kind.
meanings.sent4: The transfer of shares alienates the ownership from one investor to another.
meanings.sent5: His decision to donate the painting alienates the ownership to the museum.
